question: Which sports organisation has released rules to protect the maternity rights of its female players?
explanation:
The international governing body of football, FIFA has released new employment rules to protect the maternity rights of its female players.
It announced that any club which ended a player's contract for becoming pregnant will face compensation and a fine. FIFA is also set to mandate clubs to allow at least 14 weeks of maternity leave paid at a minimum two-thirds of a player's full salary.
